reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports as needed, Panel of Experts reports: midterm by 2 August 2019 and final by 7 February 2020
summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on the proliferation of nuclear, chemical, and biological weapons, 

1. Extends the mandate of the Panel of Experts until 24 April 2020, as specified in resolution 1874 (2009) and modified in resolution 2094 (2013), and requests the Secretary-General to take necessary administrative measures.

2. Requests the Panel to provide a midterm report to the Committee by 2 August 2019, and to the Council by 6 September 2019, and a final report to the Committee by 7 February 2020, and to the Council by 6 March 2020.

3. Requests the Panel to provide a planned programme of work to the Committee within 30 days of reappointment and to provide updates.

4. Expresses intent to continue following the work of the Panel.

5. Urges States, UN bodies, and other parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and Panel, providing information on implementation of measures imposed by relevant resolutions.

6. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
